instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What board do you have, 00840, or 00875?
Next time, post the model in the title, please.

Do you get image for sure on the internal screen?
Did you check external video?
Also check for USB activity.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> voltage check
ihave voltages on
VDDD PIN5 = 5V
VDDA PIN 18= 5V
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>=0v (no short)
.....................................................
I have check voltage in f8400 it says 13.07v
what do next?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Really strange, <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> comes from PCH and you have image.
Try doing PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If no change, then try known good LCD assembly.

threads.message: may I ask what is the voltage of <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: i test the board without lcd

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do you mean <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> was 0V [B][U]without[/U][/B] LCD connected?
What did you expect in such case, if PCH didn't detect the LCD?

Always check voltage and signals video related [B][U]with[/U][/B] LCD connected.
